playn.core
Class PointerImpl

java.lang.Object
  playn.core.PointerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pointer
public abstract class PointerImpl
extends Object
implements Pointer

Handles the common logic for all platform Pointer implementations.

Method Detail

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Description copied from interface: Pointer
Returns true if pointer interaction is enabled, false if not. Interaction is enabled by default. See Pointer.setEnabled(boolean).

Specified by:
isEnabled in interface Pointer

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Description copied from interface: Pointer
Allows pointer interaction to be temporarily disabled. No pointer events will be dispatched whilst this big switch is in the off position.

Specified by:
setEnabled in interface Pointer

listener

public Pointer.Listener listener()
Description copied from interface: Pointer
Returns the currently configured global pointer listener, or null.

Specified by:
listener in interface Pointer

setListener

public void setListener(Pointer.Listener listener)
Description copied from interface: Pointer
Sets the listener that will receive pointer events. Setting the listener to null will cause pointer events to stop being fired.

Specified by:
setListener in interface Pointer

cancelLayerDrags

public void cancelLayerDrags()
Description copied from interface: Pointer
Cancels any currently active drag interaction on a layer. This does not cancel a drag interaction being managed by the global pointer listener. This is useful if you are implementing "overlapping" interactions, like the ability to click on buttons and also the ability to flick scroll an entire interface. You might start an interaction by clicking a button, but then turn that interaction into a flick scroll by flicking your finger. Your code should then cancel the button interaction so that the user does not accidentally end up clicking the button if they happen to move finger in just the right way.

Specified by:
cancelLayerDrags in interface Pointer
